metadata.title: CVE-2014-3195 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 38.0.2125.101, does not properlytrack JavaScript heap-memory allocations as allocations of uninitializedmemory and does not properly concatenate arrays of double-precisionfloating-point numbers, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitiveinformation via crafted JavaScript code, related to thePagedSpace::AllocateRaw and NewSpace::AllocateRaw functions inheap/spaces-inl.h, the LargeObjectSpace::AllocateRaw function inheap/spaces.cc, and the Runtime_ArrayConcat function in runtime.cc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-browser-l10n - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-chromedriver - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.5-0ubuntu1').
